history.proof: intros A v P Q. split. - intros H. destruct H as [H | H]. + left. auto. + right. auto. - intros [H | H]. + apply Union_introl. auto. + apply Union_intror. auto.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall (A : Type) (v : A) (P Q : Ensemble A), Union A P Q v <-> P v \/ Q v

Premises:
Inductive GFormula (TA TX AA AF : Type) : Type := TT : Tauto.GFormula | FF : Tauto.GFormula | X : TX -> Tauto.GFormula | A : TA -> AA -> Tauto.GFormula | Cj : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | D : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | N : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | I : Tauto.GFormula -> option AF -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula For GFormula: Arguments TA, TX, AA, AF are implicit and maximally inserted For TT: Arguments TA, TX, AA, AF are implicit and maximally inserted For FF: Arguments TA, TX, AA, AF are implicit and maximally inserted For X: Arguments TA, TX, AA, AF are implicit and maximally inserted For A: Arguments TA, TX, AA, AF are implicit and maximally inserted
Record Q : Set := Qmake { Qnum : BinNums.Z; Qden : BinNums.positive } For Qmake: Argument scopes are [Z_scope positive_scope]
Union : forall U : Type, Ensemble U -> Ensemble U -> Ensemble U
Ensemble = fun U : Type => U -> Prop : Type -> Type Argument scope is [type_scope]
Intersection_spec : forall (A : Type) (v : A) (P Q : Ensemble A), Intersection A P Q v < -> P v /\ Q v
ssrbool.impliesP : forall P Q : Type, ssrbool.implies P Q -> P -> Q
List.Forall_cons : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (x : A) (l : list A), P x -> List.Forall P l -> List.Forall P (x :: l)
list_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> Prop), P nil -> (forall (a : A) (l : list A), P l -> P (a :: l)%list) -> forall l : list A, P l
List.Forall_nil : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop), List.Forall P nil
Union_sind : forall (U : Type) (B C : Ensemble U) (P : U -> SProp), (forall x : U, In U B x -> P x) -> (forall x : U, In U C x -> P x) -> forall u : U, Union U B C u -> P u
Union_ind : forall (U : Type) (B C : Ensemble U) (P : U -> Prop), (forall x : U, In U B x -> P x) -> (forall x : U, In U C x -> P x) -> forall u : U, Union U B C u -> P u
Inductive Forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) : list A -> Prop := Forall_nil : List.Forall P nil | Forall_cons : forall (x : A) (l : list A), P x -> List.Forall P l -> List.Forall P (x :: l) For Forall: Argument A is implicit For Forall_nil: Argument A is implicit For Forall_cons: Arguments A, P, l are implicit For Forall: Argument scopes are [type_scope function_scope list_scope] For Forall_nil: Argument scopes are [type_scope function_scope] For Forall_cons: Argument scopes are [type_scope function_scope _ list_scope _ _]
SetoidList.InA_app_iff : forall (A : Type) (eqA : A -> A -> Prop) (l1 l2 : list A) (x : A), SetoidList.InA eqA x (l1 ++ l2) < -> SetoidList.InA eqA x l1 \/ SetoidList.InA eqA x l2
SetoidList.InA_alt : forall (A : Type) (eqA : A -> A -> Prop) (x : A) (l : list A), SetoidList.InA eqA x l < -> (exists y : A, eqA x y /\ List.In y l)
SetoidList.InA_app : forall (A : Type) (eqA : A -> A -> Prop) (l1 l2 : list A) (x : A), SetoidList.InA eqA x (l1 ++ l2) -> SetoidList.InA eqA x l1 \/ SetoidList.InA eqA x l2
ssrbool.unlessP : forall C P : Prop, ssrbool.unless C P < -> C \/ P
List.in_or_app : forall (A : Type) (l m : list A) (a : A), List.In a l \/ List.In a m -> List.In a (l ++ m)
ssrbool.introT : forall (P : Prop) (b : bool), Bool.reflect P b -> P -> is_true b
ssrbool.elimTF : forall (P : Prop) (b c : bool), Bool.reflect P b -> b = c -> if c then P else ~ P
Inhabited_sind : forall (U : Type) (B : Ensemble U) (P : SProp), (forall x : U, In U B x -> P) -> Inhabited U B -> P
Inhabited_ind : forall (U : Type) (B : Ensemble U) (P : Prop), (forall x : U, In U B x -> P) -> Inhabited U B -> P
Intersection_ind : forall (U : Type) (B C : Ensemble U) (P : U -> Prop), (forall x : U, In U B x -> In U C x -> P x) -> forall u : U, Intersection U B C u -> P u
Intersection_sind : forall (U : Type) (B C : Ensemble U) (P : U -> SProp), (forall x : U, In U B x -> In U C x -> P x) -> forall u : U, Intersection U B C u -> P u
List.elements_in_partition : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> bool) (l l1 l2 : list A), List.partition f l = (l1, l2) -> forall x : A, List.In x l < -> List.In x l1 \/ List.In x l2
FSetPositive.PositiveSet.tree_ind : forall P : FSetPositive.PositiveSet.tree -> Prop, P FSetPositive.PositiveSet.Leaf -> (forall t : FSetPositive.PositiveSet.tree, P t -> forall (b : bool) (t0 : FSetPositive.PositiveSet.tree), P t0 -> P (FSetPositive.PositiveSet.Node t b t0)) -> forall t : FSetPositive.PositiveSet.tree, P t
Disjoint_ind : forall (U : Type) (B C : Ensemble U) (P : Prop), ((forall x : U, ~ In U (Intersection U B C) x) -> P) -> Disjoint U B C -> P
Disjoint_rect : forall (U : Type) (B C : Ensemble U) (P : Type), ((forall x : U, ~ In U (Intersection U B C) x) -> P) -> Disjoint U B C -> P
Disjoint_sind : forall (U : Type) (B C : Ensemble U) (P : SProp), ((forall x : U, ~ In U (Intersection U B C) x) -> P) -> Disjoint U B C -> P
Disjoint_rec : forall (U : Type) (B C : Ensemble U) (P : Set), ((forall x : U, ~ In U (Intersection U B C) x) -> P) -> Disjoint U B C -> P
Included_Empty : forall (U : Type) (A : Ensemble U), Included U (Empty_set U) A
Extensionality_Ensembles : forall (U : Type) (A B : Ensemble U), Same_set U A B -> A = B
Add_inv : forall (U : Type) (A : Ensemble U) (x y : U), In U (Add U A x) y -> In U A y \/ x = y
Inhabited_add : forall (U : Type) (A : Ensemble U) (x : U), Inhabited U (Add U A x)
Add_not_Empty : forall (U : Type) (A : Ensemble U) (x : U), Add U A x <> Empty_set U

```coq
intros A v P Q.
split.
- intros H. destruct H as [H | H].
  + left. assumption.
  + right. assumption.
- intros [H | H].
  + apply Union_introl. assumption.
  + apply Union_intror. assumption.
Qed.```

original: intros A v P Q. split. - intros H. destruct H as [H | H]. + left. auto. + right. auto. - intros [H | H]. + apply Union_introl. auto. + apply Union_intror. auto.
